How ant saved 
 dove 
 
 Kholeka Mabeta and Judith
 Baker 
 English 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 It was a hot sumer day in 
 
 the dry forest. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Litle Ant had no water for 
 
 many days. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 2  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 “I ned a drop of water, 
 
 even if it fals from a leaf.” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 3  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 But even the dew had dried 
 
 up. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 “If I don’t drink, I wil die,” 
 
 cried Litle Ant. 
 
 “I must go to the river I 
 
 have heard about.” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 5  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 “The river wil swep you 
 
 away,” a wise squirel 
 
 warned him. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 But Litle Ant was so 
 
 thirsty. 
 
 “I wil die if I don’t drink 
 
 some water.” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 7  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Litle Ant went to lok for 
 
 the river… 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 8  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 acros dry gras and over 
 
 dry branches… 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 9  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 .until he heard the waves 
 
 of the river splashing. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 10  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Litle Ant tok a long sip of 
 
 col water. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 He was so hapy he did 
 
 not se the huge wave 
 
 coming. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 12  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Ant tried to grab the dry 
 
 gras floating past him. 
 
 But he was swept away by 
 
 the water. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 13  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 “Help someone. Help me 
 
 please.” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 14  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 “Quick, climb on,” said 
 
 White Dove, holding a 
 
 branch in his beak. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 15  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 16  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 “I canot leave until I say 
 
 thank you to the dove. I wil 
 
 wait until he comes back to 
 
 drink.” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 17  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 One day as he waited, two 
 
 boys came to the river with 
 
 their slingshots. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 18  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 “There is a big white dove 
 
 that comes here to drink,” 
 
 said one boy. 
 
 “We wil have it for super 
 
 tonight.” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 19  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 20  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 “I canot let the boys kil 
 
 White Dove. 
 
 But I am so tiny, what can I 
 
 do?” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 21  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Just then White Dove flew 
 
 down from the tre to 
 
 drink. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 2  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 23  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Litle Ant had an idea. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 24  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 He jumped onto one boy’s 
 
 fot, and bit him as hard as 
 
 he could. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 25  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The boy jumped. “Ouch!” 
 
 he cried. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 26  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 White Dove was startled 
 
 and flew away to safety. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 27  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 That was how Litle Ant 
 
 thanked White Dove for 
 
 saving him.
